snippet.textDisplay:
This is deceiving. Damn it is. This tune makes you think that this game is a lighthearted game, but one hour into the game and BAM, an NPC is dead. And it gets worse. God, it's a very good game.
And composed by Kouhei Tanaka, the composer of One Piece's first opening.
snippet.textOriginal:
This is deceiving. Damn it is. This tune makes you think that this game is a lighthearted game, but one hour into the game and BAM, an NPC is dead. And it gets worse. God, it's a very good game.
And composed by Kouhei Tanaka, the composer of One Piece's first opening.

snippet.textDisplay: heh, don't know if it's just me but, this, crusader of centy, landstalker...all give out the feeling of wanting. after beating each of these games. like a lonelyness sets in. zelda not so much. probly has to do with them being almost overlooked. and also about how the stories end on kind of bittersweet. Lunar is almost like that, but the amount of mushy and corny storytelling just about sets it apart.

snippet.textDisplay: Ahh yes... Alundra!  Great game!  Unfortunately it's on my list of games I still have to finish.  I really loved the soundtrack for this one too.  I got stuck on one part of the game and never finished.  There are several tracks from this game that are great to listen to.  The composer, Kohei Tanaka, has actually done more music for anime than games.  Check out the Wikipedia entry on him.
snippet.textOriginal: Ahh yes... Alundra!  Great game!  Unfortunately it's on my list of games I still have to finish.  I really loved the soundtrack for this one too.  I got stuck on one part of the game and never finished.  There are several tracks from this game that are great to listen to.  The composer, Kohei Tanaka, has actually done more music for anime than games.  Check out the Wikipedia entry on him.

snippet.textDisplay: My favorite song from the whole game.  I'm a huge fan of smooth jazz and classical.  It's interesting how this song fuses them together.  The "oouh"! sounds make it sound somewhat 'live', like a song from the 70s or 80s, I guess another thing I liked about this song.
snippet.textOriginal: My favorite song from the whole game.  I'm a huge fan of smooth jazz and classical.  It's interesting how this song fuses them together.  The "oouh"! sounds make it sound somewhat 'live', like a song from the 70s or 80s, I guess another thing I liked about this song.
